metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11500 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
In Dovecot before 2.2.36.4 and 2.3.x before 2.3.7.2 (and Pigeonhole before0.5.7.2), protocol processing can fail for quoted strings. This occursbecause '\0' characters are mishandled, and can lead to out-of-boundswrites and remote code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11500` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dovecot-core - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11
dovecot-gssapi - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11
dovecot-imapd - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11
dovecot-ldap - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11
dovecot-lmtpd - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11
dovecot-lucene - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11
dovecot-managesieved - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11
dovecot-mysql - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11
dovecot-pgsql - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11
dovecot-pop3d - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11
dovecot-sieve - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11
dovecot-solr - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11
dovecot-sqlite - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11
mail-stack-delivery - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dovecot package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.11').
